intro: Sphyranthera lutescens, commonly known as the golden sphyranthera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal sand dunes and rocky habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are clustered in dense, cylindrical inflorescences, and it is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Sphyranthera lutescens is also valued for its ecological role in supporting native pollinators.
